dining_options.name: Thames Street Oyster House (Baltimore)
dining_options.description: Outstanding seafood in charming Fells Point. Known for exceptional raw bar and traditional Chesapeake dishes with an upscale twist.

hours.Friday-Sunday: Lunch: 11:30 AM - 2:30 PM, Dinner: 5:00 PM - 9:30 PM

dining_options.additional_details: Brass-&-wood-trimmed eatery with a raw bar and Eastern coastal fare. Serves happy hour food and great cocktails.

dining_options.name: Ekiben (Baltimore)
dining_options.description: Cult favorite known for steamed bun sandwiches and small plates with Taiwanese, Thai, and Korean influences.
dining_options.additional_details: Asian restaurant specializing in steamed buns, bowls, and small plates. Serves vegan dishes and offers outdoor seating.

dining_options.name: La Cuchara (Baltimore)
dining_options.description: Upscale Basque restaurant with wood-fired cooking, excellent pintxos, and a sophisticated wine list.
dining_options.additional_details: Basque-inspired cuisine featuring a wood-fired grill and central bar. Offers pintxos and tapas in a casual elegant setting.

dining_options.name: Clavel (Baltimore)
dining_options.description: Authentic Sinaloan cuisine with house-made tortillas, exceptional ceviche, and one of the best mezcal selections on the East Coast.
dining_options.additional_details: Family-run Mexican taqueria and mezcaleria. Celebrating 10 years in business in 2025. Features a traditional nixtamalería.

dining_options.name: The Food Market (Baltimore)
dining_options.description: Modern comfort food with creative twists in a buzzy, industrial-chic space. Popular for brunch and dinner.
dining_options.additional_details: Located in a former grocery store with an open kitchen. Serves creative American cuisine and cocktails.

dining_options.name: Petit Louis Bistro (Baltimore)
dining_options.description: Classic French bistro with charming atmosphere, traditional dishes like coq au vin and steak frites, and an all-French wine list.
dining_options.additional_details: Charming French bistro in Roland Park. Offers classic French fare and a well-stocked wine cellar.

dining_options.name: Cinghiale (Baltimore)
dining_options.description: Upscale Northern Italian cuisine with excellent pasta, an award-winning wine list, and elegant dining rooms overlooking the harbor.
dining_options.additional_details: Baltimore's best Italian restaurant and wine bar with two distinct atmospheres: Osteria (elegant dining room) and Enoteca (wine bar).

dining_options.name: Faidley Seafood (Baltimore)
dining_options.description: Historic market stall (since 1886) known for award-winning lump crab cakes and fresh seafood. A Baltimore institution.
dining_options.additional_details: World Famous Jumbo Lump Crab Cake ($24.95). Located in the new Lexington Market. Established since 1886.

dining_options.name: Miss Shirley's Cafe (Baltimore)
dining_options.description: Beloved breakfast and brunch spot with Southern-inspired dishes like crab benedict and coconut cream-stuffed French toast.
dining_options.additional_details: Award-winning breakfast, brunch, and lunch restaurant. Featured on Food Network's Diners, Drive-Ins & Dives. Celebrating 20th Anniversary in April 2025.

dining_options.name: LP Steamers (Baltimore)
dining_options.description: No-frills crab house serving steamed Maryland blue crabs, crab cakes, and other seafood favorites. Rooftop deck with city views.
dining_options.additional_details: Laidback seafood joint with a rooftop deck offering city views. Specializes in Maryland-style steamed crabs.

dining_options.name: Hersh's Pizza & Drinks (Baltimore)
dining_options.description: Neapolitan-style pizzas with creative toppings, craft cocktails, and homemade pasta in a relaxed setting.

dining_options.name: Sotto Sopra (Baltimore)
dining_options.description: Handmade pasta, seafood, and meat dishes in an elegant setting with murals and occasional opera nights.

dining_options.name: Gertrude's at the BMA (Baltimore)
dining_options.description: Modern American cuisine in the Baltimore Museum of Art with a patio and locally focused menu.

dining_options.name: Blue Moon Cafe (Baltimore)
dining_options.description: Colorful 24-hour diner known for Cap'n Crunch French toast, hearty breakfast platters, and quirky vibes.

dining_options.name: Le Diplomate (DC)
dining_options.description: Parisian-style brasserie with steak frites, onion soup, and charming outdoor seating.

dining_options.name: Maketto (DC)
dining_options.description: A combined café, boutique, and Cambodian/Taiwanese fusion restaurant with trend-forward street food.

dining_options.name: Puerto 511 (Baltimore)
dining_options.description: Intimate Peruvian restaurant with exceptional ceviche, rotisserie chicken, and flavorful traditional dishes.

shopping_locations.name: Georgetown Shopping District (DC)
shopping_locations.description: Charming cobblestone streets lined with upscale stores, national retailers, and unique boutiques. A DC favorite.
shopping_locations.additional_details: 47 new businesses opened in 2024. Features cobblestone streets and stylish stores. Over 200 small businesses currently operate in the district.

shopping_locations.name: Harbor East (Baltimore)
shopping_locations.description: Waterfront shopping and dining district with designer boutiques, national retailers, and scenic harbor views.
shopping_locations.additional_details: A compact 12-block shopping and dining district in the heart of Baltimore Harbor. Hosting FashionEASTa 2025 on Saturday, June 7, 2025.

shopping_locations.name: Lexington Market (Baltimore)
shopping_locations.description: America's oldest public market recently renovated with 50+ food and specialty vendors. A true Baltimore landmark.
shopping_locations.additional_details: Recently renovated market with over 200 years of history. 60,000 square feet of merchant stalls with more than 100 vendors.

shopping_locations.name: CityCenterDC (DC)
shopping_locations.description: Stylish, open-air shopping complex featuring global luxury brands and modern architecture in downtown DC.

shopping_locations.name: Union Market (DC)
shopping_locations.description: Trendy DC spot for local food stalls, home goods, indie boutiques, and pop-up events in a warehouse-chic setting.
shopping_locations.additional_details: A culinary hub with over 60 food and beverage partners. Hosting events like The Rumpus Room Family Dance Party Spring Jam 2025 (May 18) and That's So Vintage Market 2025 (April 12).

shopping_locations.name: The Village at Shirlington (Arlington)
shopping_locations.description: Charming outdoor shopping district with gift shops, local stores, independent bookshops, and bistros just outside DC.

shopping_locations.name: Hampden (The Avenue) (Baltimore)
shopping_locations.description: Eclectic 36th Street corridor filled with indie shops, vintage treasures, quirky gifts, and funky local flavor.

casino_attractions.name: Horseshoe Casino Baltimore (Baltimore)
casino_attractions.description: Large, lively casino offering poker, slots, table games, and celebrity chef restaurants like Gordon Ramsay Steak.
casino_attractions.gaming_options: 1,338 slot machines, 115 table games, over 2,500 total gaming options
casino_attractions.additional_details: 122,000 sq. ft. gaming floor. Recently transformed parking garage into a $6 million concert venue called 'Level One'.

casino_attractions.name: MGM National Harbor (DC Area)
casino_attractions.description: Luxurious gaming, entertainment, and dining destination with river views, upscale shops, and high-stakes poker.
casino_attractions.address: 101 MGM National Ave, Oxon Hill, MD 20745
casino_attractions.additional_details: 4-star hotel and casino with a 3,000-seat theater, multiple restaurants and bars, and a spa & salon.
